column4: k, so this is becoming quite moot, but ne1 here knows anything abt fixing sleep/resume problems on laptops with ubuntu?
is there an advanced #ubuntu channel??
uname -a = "Linux tux-hp 2.6.31-20-generic #58-Ubuntu SMP Fri Mar 12 05:23:09 UTC 2010 i686 GNU/Linux"
when trying to sleep
it goes to sleep correctly, after that, when resuming it hangs with a black screen
cat /proc/cpuinfo = "  processor : 0 vendor_id : AuthenticAMD cpu family : 15 model  : 44 model name : Mobile AMD Sempron(tm) Processor 3300+ stepping : 2"
lspci | grep VGA="01:05.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon XPRESS 200M 5955 (PCIE)"
it's quite old ActionParsnip
brand / type laptop ?
but it works very robustly, I simply need the sleep option, because my battery is very old
it is HP Pavilion dv5000
and last I checked it is using the Radeon driver
[drm] Initialized radeon 1.31.0 20080528 for 0000:01:05.0 on minor 0
hm i thought this channel was supposed to be for grownups that have an interest on ubuntu aetr
k
any thing particular I have to look at ?
where do I look for it ( i mean in which log)?
got it
it doesn't have any message with error on it
With wireless disabled hibernate works ??
I haven't tried hibernate that much, but right now i'm wired not wireless
can i give it a go now?
it confirms this old bug > https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/91968
